intro: Myosotis vulgaris, commonly known as the common forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers with a white center, which bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Myosotis vulgaris is also cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and symbolic meaning of remembrance.
